ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Error in cantera installation
ygData.msgSnippet: The file _cantera.pyd should be all you need. It looks to me like you have installed Cantera somewhere other than in the site_packages directory that is the

The file _cantera.pyd should be all you need. It looks to me like you  
have installed Cantera somewhere other than in the site_packages  
directory that is the default. If so, did you set environment variable  
PYTHONPATH to point to this directory? You might try reinstalling in  
site_packages to see if that helps... otherwise I'm not sure. Anyone  
else have this problem?

Dave


On Tuesday, September 30, 2003, at 04:39 AM, galliumnitrid wrote:

> Dear Dr. Goodwin,
> I just installed cantera(1.5) and python on my windows computer.
> As I wanted to test it, I received the following error message:
> Traceback (most recent call last):

> line 6, in -toplevel-
>     from Cantera import *
>   File "D:\PROGRA~1\KINETICS\Python\Cantera\__init__.py", line 7, in -
> toplevel-
>     from gases import *
>   File "D:\PROGRA~1\KINETICS\Python\Cantera\gases.py", line 4, in -
> toplevel-

>   File "D:\PROGRA~1\KINETICS\Python\Cantera\ThermoPhase.py", line 4,
> in -toplevel-

>   File "D:\PROGRA~1\KINETICS\Python\Cantera\Phase.py", line 7, in -
> toplevel-

> ImportError: No module named _cantera
>
> I found a file named _cantera.pyd but none called _cantera.py
>
> Could you help me?
> Thank you!
> B. Atakan
